title: Volkswagen targets layoffs and 10% pay cuts amid plans for German plant closures, union says
content: Volkswagen is considering wide spread pay cuts and layoffs as well as closures or size reductions of its plants in Germany, the company's works council said Monday.
summary: Volkswagen is considering wide spread pay cuts and layoffs as well as closures or size reductions of its plants in Germany, the company's works council said Monday.

title: Japan's central bank to remain undeterred on rate hikes despite LDP's electoral shock, analysts say
content: Roughly 86% of economists polled by Reuters expect the central bank to leave its rates unchanged when it announces its decision Thursday.
summary: Roughly 86% of economists polled by Reuters expect the central bank to leave its rates unchanged when it announces its decision Thursday.

title: Foreign investors flock to flagship Saudi economic conference — but face less free-flowing cash
content: Thousands of financiers, founders and investors are set to descend on the Saudi capital of Riyadh for the eighth edition of the kingdom's Future Investment Initiative.
summary: Thousands of financiers, founders and investors are set to descend on the Saudi capital of Riyadh for the eighth edition of the kingdom's Future Investment Initiative.

title: Britain's Labour government to deliver debut Budget this week, settling weeks of uncertainty
content: U.K. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves will deliver the government's hotly awaited debut budget on Wednesday, putting to bed weeks of uncertainty over potential tax hikes and spending cuts.
summary: U.K. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves will deliver the government's hotly awaited debut budget on Wednesday, putting to bed weeks of uncertainty over potential tax hikes and spending cuts.

title: China's industrial profits plunge at fastest pace since the pandemic
content: The country's industrial profits declined 27.1% year-on-year in September.
summary: The country's industrial profits declined 27.1% year-on-year in September.

title: F1 championships are increasingly being decided by how teams use new technology
content: With the cost-cap limiting budgets to $135 million per year, automating repetitive tasks is crucial to ensuring teams are using their resources efficiently.
summary: With the cost-cap limiting budgets to $135 million per year, automating repetitive tasks is crucial to ensuring teams are using their resources efficiently.

title: Vietnam waits for major upgrade to its $200 billion stock market
content: Vietnam's chip capabilities have it competing against near neighbor Malaysia, attracting global semiconductor firms.
summary: Vietnam's chip capabilities have it competing against near neighbor Malaysia, attracting global semiconductor firms.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Nasdaq hits all-time high even amid poor earnings growth
content: Even though almost three-quarters of S&P companies have beaten expectations, according to FactSet data, the rate of profit growth has not met expectations.
summary: Even though almost three-quarters of S&P companies have beaten expectations, according to FactSet data, the rate of profit growth has not met expectations.

title: Olympus shares drop over 5% after CEO resigns over drug allegation
content: The stock slid 5.3% on the Tokyo Stock Exchange following news of Stefan Kaufmann's resignation.
summary: The stock slid 5.3% on the Tokyo Stock Exchange following news of Stefan Kaufmann's resignation.

title: Japan's Shigeru Ishiba suggests he intends to stay on as PM after ruling coalition loses majority
content: It is the first time since 2009 that the Liberal Democratic Party has lost its parliamentary majority.
summary: It is the first time since 2009 that the Liberal Democratic Party has lost its parliamentary majority.

title: Oil prices plunge 6% after Israel's attack spares Iran's energy facilities
content: Oil prices lost ground on Monday after Iranian energy facilities were not damaged during an Israeli attack over the weekend.
summary: Oil prices lost ground on Monday after Iranian energy facilities were not damaged during an Israeli attack over the weekend.

title: McDonald's Quarter Pounder burgers to return to restaurants affected by E. coli outbreak
content: The Colorado Department of Agriculture's testing did not detect E. coli in samples of the beef patties taken from McDonald's restaurants in the area.
summary: The Colorado Department of Agriculture's testing did not detect E. coli in samples of the beef patties taken from McDonald's restaurants in the area.

title: Biden says Elon Musk was an 'illegal worker' when he began U.S. career
content: Elon Musk has become a regular campaign surrogate for Donald Trump in the presidential race against Vice President Kamala Harris.
summary: Elon Musk has become a regular campaign surrogate for Donald Trump in the presidential race against Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: Trump doubles down on replacing income taxes with tariffs in Joe Rogan interview
content: Vice President Kamala Harris has attacked the tariff policy proposed by Donald Trump, calling it effectively a "sales tax" on Americans.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris has attacked the tariff policy proposed by Donald Trump, calling it effectively a "sales tax" on Americans.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Nasdaq hits high even as poor earnings growth disappoints investors
content: Even though almost three-quarters of S&P companies have beaten expectations, according to FactSet data, the rate of profit growth has not met expectations.
summary: Even though almost three-quarters of S&P companies have beaten expectations, according to FactSet data, the rate of profit growth has not met expectations.

title: Jeff Bezos killed Washington Post endorsement of Kamala Harris, paper reports
content: The Washington Post planned to endorse Kamala Harris over Donald Trump before owner Jeff Bezos, the Amazon founder, decided against it, the newspaper reported.
summary: The Washington Post planned to endorse Kamala Harris over Donald Trump before owner Jeff Bezos, the Amazon founder, decided against it, the newspaper reported.

title: German finance minister warns of retaliation if U.S. kicks off trade war
content: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Friday warned that if the U.S. kicked off a trade war with the European Union, there could be retaliation.
summary: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Friday warned that if the U.S. kicked off a trade war with the European Union, there could be retaliation.

title: Elon Musk's secret talks with Putin ramped up during his Twitter takeover: WSJ report
content: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has engaged in secret talks with Vladimir Putin since late 2022, The Wall Street Journal reports.
summary: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has engaged in secret talks with Vladimir Putin since late 2022, The Wall Street Journal reports.

title: Delta sues CrowdStrike after widespread IT outage that caused thousands of cancellations
content: Delta is seeking damages for its losses from the July IT incident, as well as litigation costs and punitive damages.
summary: Delta is seeking damages for its losses from the July IT incident, as well as litigation costs and punitive damages.

title: What McDonald's needs to do next after E. coli outbreak
content: Health authorities are investigating the source of the E. coli outbreak that has sickened 75 and led to one death.
summary: Health authorities are investigating the source of the E. coli outbreak that has sickened 75 and led to one death.

title: How United is trying to overtake Delta as the world's most profitable airline
content: United Airlines has been trying to expand its profits by investing heavily in roomier seats and growing a network that will excite high-spending travelers.
summary: United Airlines has been trying to expand its profits by investing heavily in roomier seats and growing a network that will excite high-spending travelers.

title: Abercrombie ex-CEO Mike Jeffries pleads not guilty in sex crimes case
content: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO Mike Jeffries, his partner Matthew Smith and associate James Jacobson face sex trafficking and interstate prostitution charges.
summary: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO Mike Jeffries, his partner Matthew Smith and associate James Jacobson face sex trafficking and interstate prostitution charges.

title: Cruise lines are having a moment as a popular — and cheaper — alternative to hotels
content: The pricing gap between cruises and land-based lodging is even wider than it appears, according to UBS.
summary: The pricing gap between cruises and land-based lodging is even wider than it appears, according to UBS.

title: Russia's central bank raises key rate to 21% to rein in higher-than-forecast inflation
content: Russia's central bank on Friday raised its key interest rate by 200 basis points to 21%, citing higher-than-forecast consumer price increases.
summary: Russia's central bank on Friday raised its key interest rate by 200 basis points to 21%, citing higher-than-forecast consumer price increases.

title: Inflation undershoots to jumbo cuts: What 10 European Central Bank members said this week
content: A slew of Governing Council members spoke to CNBC at the International Monetary Fund's annual meeting in Washington, D.C. this week.
summary: A slew of Governing Council members spoke to CNBC at the International Monetary Fund's annual meeting in Washington, D.C. this week.

title: New York Stock Exchange to extend after-hours trading
content: Trading would open at 1:30 a.m. and end at 11:30 p.m. ET on weekdays on the Arca electronics exchange, if approved by regulators.
summary: Trading would open at 1:30 a.m. and end at 11:30 p.m. ET on weekdays on the Arca electronics exchange, if approved by regulators.

title: China schedules meeting expected to reveal fiscal stimulus details
content: Investors have been awaiting the gathering of the standing committee of the National People's Congress, watchful for details on any fiscal stimulus.
summary: Investors have been awaiting the gathering of the standing committee of the National People's Congress, watchful for details on any fiscal stimulus.

title: Malaysia must avoid 'boom-bust' cycles to finally claim Asian Tiger status, central bank governor says
content: Governor of Malaysian Central Bank has high hopes that 'Asian Tiger' status is near
summary: Governor of Malaysian Central Bank has high hopes that 'Asian Tiger' status is near

title: Microsoft CEO Nadella asked for pay reduction after security slip, but total comp still rose 63%
content: Following cyberattacks from China and Russia, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella asked for his pay to be reduced.
summary: Following cyberattacks from China and Russia, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella asked for his pay to be reduced.

title: South and North Korea troops potentially entering Ukraine war unlikely to stoke regional conflict, analysts say
content: The U.S. has confirmed that North Korean troops have been sent to Russia, with Ukraine President Zelenskyy pegging the North Korean troop count at 12,000.
summary: The U.S. has confirmed that North Korean troops have been sent to Russia, with Ukraine President Zelenskyy pegging the North Korean troop count at 12,000.
